sentence.Network_en: The music of the song has been rearranged for the cantata.
sentence.Network_cn: 这支歌改编已成大合唱.

sentence.Network_en: The choral society sang the new cantata composed by its leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 该合唱队演唱了他们领队编写的大合唱.

sentence.Network_en: The cantata has a difficult vocal score.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个康塔塔有个难度很大的声乐总谱.

【康塔塔】　（Cantata）大型声乐套曲体裁的一种。原意为“用声乐演唱”。

原为巴哈宗教清唱剧(sacred cantata) BWV 147中的一首合唱曲。表面上是应宗教需要而成的作品，然而古典音乐的发展与教会自开始 …
教会清唱曲 (ChurcCh cantata)BWV 1-199。 世俗清唱曲 (Secular CantatasS)BWV 201一216。 经文歌 (Motets),BWV 118, 225 - 230、受难曲 (Passiobs),BWV.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Italian cantata (aria) 'sung (air'), from cantare 'sing'

entry.tran: 康塔塔(适合歌唱及演奏的短小音乐作品)
entry.def: A cantata is a fairly short musical work for singers and instruments.

means.word_mean: 1. a musical composition for voices and orchestra based on a religious text
